page.title: 08CRIME IN PAISLEY
page.content: Situated in the west of Scotland, Paisley's crime rate is steadily increasing. There are a number of reasons for this, the main ones being the increase in alcoholism, drugs abuse and glue sniffing. The use of drugs is the most worrying of these problems as addicts are driven to great lenghths to fund their hab- bit, leading to an increase in theft and burglaries. This lack of money and amenities in problem areas such as Ferguslie Park can lead to other prob- lems such as discontent which can lead to vandalism, thus leading to more crime. Policing these areas is difficult. Special community involvement prog- rammes are being set up to combat crime, but lack of funds and the difficult task mean that not enough is being put into these programmes.
